docs.title: Quick Start (API v1)
docs.text: Follow these steps to integrate m-pay payments.

docs.title: Basic Flow
docs.text:
1. Receive account and secret keys
  2. Register payment
  3. Execute payment or redirect payer
  4. Confirm result via Payment Status

```bash POST https://test.ecom.m-pay.me/api/payment/start POST https://test.ecom.m-pay.me/api/payment/execute POST https://test.ecom.m-pay.me/api/payment/operate

docs.title: Authentication & Signatures
docs.text:
All requests to the m-pay API must be authenticated using a digital signature.

The signature guarantees: - Merchant identification - Request integrity - Protection against data tampering

Requests without a valid signature are rejected.

docs.title: Merchant Credentials
docs.text:
Each merchant is provided with:

  • Account (merchant account number)
  • Secret keys (one or two, depending on configuration)
  • Signature algorithm

Secret keys must be stored securely and never exposed client-side.

docs.title: Supported Signature Algorithms
docs.text:
The following algorithms are supported:

  • MD5
  • HMAC-SHA256

The algorithm used must match the one configured for the merchant account.

docs.title: Signature Generation Rules
docs.text:
Signature generation follows strict rules:

  1. Collect all request parameters except signature
  2. Sort parameters alphabetically by parameter name
  3. Concatenate only parameter values
  4. Append merchant secret keys
  5. Apply the hashing algorithm
  6. Convert the result to uppercase

Empty parameters must not be included.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: amount=100.25 amountcurr=EUR account=ACC123 number=ORD001

docs.title: Concatenated string
docs.text: 100.25EURACC123ORD001SECRETKEY

docs.title: Signature Validation
docs.text:
All responses from m-pay are also signed.

Merchants must: 1. Recalculate the response signature 2. Compare it with the received signature 3. Accept the response only if signatures match

docs.title: Security Recommendations
docs.text:
• Generate signatures server-side only
  • Never log secret keys
  • Always use HTTPS
  • Validate response signatures

docs.title: General Notes
docs.text: The m-pay Merchant API is designed for secure processing of online payments, wallet payments, recurring transactions, refunds, and payouts using server-to-server communication.

docs.title: Technical Requirements
docs.text:
• Protocol: HTTPS only
  • HTTP Method: POST
  • Encoding: UTF-8
  • Request format: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

All requests must be sent from a secure backend environment.

Client-side requests are not allowed.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
Each request must contain a valid digital signature generated using merchant secret keys.

Requests without a valid signature will be rejected.

docs.title: Important Rules
docs.text:
• Redirects and browser responses are not proof of payment
  • Always confirm payment result via Payment Status
  • Store transID for every transaction
  • Do not retry payment execution blindly
